title: Improve bash/Gum UI as graceful fallback
description:
Enhance the bash UI (using Gum where available) to be a LIVE, INTERACTIVE fallback when Ink UI fails.

CRITICAL: Must display the EXACT SAME information as Ink UI - no missing data.
CRITICAL: Must be LIVE with file watching, not static snapshots.

Creative approaches for live updates:
- Gum + fswatch loop (re-render on file change)
- ANSI cursor positioning (update in place)
- Gum spin with background status updates
- tmux split pane option

Goals:
- Feature parity with Ink UI (same info, also live)
- Interactive/live updates via fswatch or polling
- Graceful degradation when Gum not installed (pure ANSI)
- Fix truncation/wrapping issues

=== LIVE UPDATES ===

Re-render dashboard on story file changes
Use ANSI cursor positioning for smooth in-place updates
Alive indicator updates without full re-render
=== GUM AVAILABILITY ===
Add _ralph_has_gum() check function
With Gum: use gum style for boxes, gum spin for spinners
Without Gum: pure ANSI fallback (still live)
=== VISUAL IMPROVEMENTS ===

Fix notification topic truncation (wrap instead)
